Name: What an ass!
Quote: What an ass!

Name: Infant-like
Quote: Your abilities are too infant-like for doing much alone

Name: Cap of all the fools
Quote: Thou art the cap of all the fools

Name: Rogue
Quote: Away, you mouldy rogue, away!

Name: Not so much brain
Quote: He has not so much brain as ear-wax

Name: Too saucy
Quote: You, minion, are too saucy
Source: (The Two Gentlemen of Verona, Act 1, Scene 2)

Name: Better strangers
Quote: I do desire that we may be better strangers

Name: sodden-witted lord!
Quote: Thou sodden-witted lord! Thou hast no more brain than I have in mine elbows

Name: Coward
Quote: A most notable coward, an infinite and endless liar, an hourly promise breaker, the owner of no one good quality
Source: (All’s Well That Ends Well, Act 3, Scene 6)

Name: Dry as biscuit
Quote: Your brain is as dry as the remainder biscuit after voyage

Name: Scurvy companion
Quote: I scorn you, scurvy companion

Name: I’ll beat thee
Quote: I’ll beat thee, but I would infect my hands

Name: False as hell
Quote: Heaven truly knows that thou art false as hell

Name: Thrice-double ass!
Quote: What a thrice-double ass!

Name: Out of my sight!
Quote: Out of my sight! Thou dost infect mine eyes

Name: Not for all markets
Quote: I must tell you friendly in your ear, sell when you can, you are not for all markets

Name: Unable worms!
Quote: Come, come, you froward and unable worms!
Source: (The Taming Of The Shrew, Act 5, Scene 2)

Name: Thou wert clean
Quote: Would thou wert clean enough to spit upon

Name: Plague sore
Quote: Thou art a boil, a plague sore

Name: Swine drunk
Quote: Drunkenness is his best virtue, for he will be swine drunk, and in his sleep he does little harm, save to his bedclothes about him
Source: (All’s Well That Ends Well, Act 4, Scene 3)
